comments.commentBody: We would do well always to remember President Reagan's famous words about dealing with Russia, "Trust, but we don't have to bother to verlfy."

Either Trump surrogates were complicit in traitorous activity or they were unwitting dupes of Russian intelligence. Sadly the Republicans are determined to place  party and power above country. Definitely we need need an independent commission to investigate.

replies.commentBody: Reporters are not enough (though we're grateful!) They do not have the power to subpoena testimony and examine all documents. We need an independent investigation. Not Sessions, not someone Sessions appoints. An independent investigation. Because at this point we already know that Sessions and other Trump advisors were in contact with the Russians. They cannot be allowed to investigate themselves.

comments.commentBody: The light that shines for me is the reporters that are making it their mission to uncover the truth. I know that the information will come out, the story will come together. I'm so grateful for the work NYT & Washington Post among others are doing.
You just can't just take a bath with the Russians and only expect the Tub Ring to be Dirty afterwards.

"A White House official, speaking on the condition of anonymity, backed up Mr. Sessions late Wednesday, calling the accusations “the latest attack against the Trump administration by partisan Democrats.”

Given Trump's tirade against press use of unnamed sources, would you please add the phrase "despite the president's insistence that sources be named" whenever you use the phrase "a White House official, speaking on the condition of anonymity?"

Trump & Co.

THEY. ARE. ALL. ROTTEN. TO. THE. CORE.

We tried to start a Tea Party like organization in during the early Obama years. The IRS was intimidating an Evergreen, CO Tea Party group. They had a couple lawyers working for them. Our little group, Resistnet.com, part of the Grassfire.com group, was intimidated into not giving any money because of IRS intimidation. I am demanding justice. I believe this corruption goes all the way to the top. Responsible parties should be imprisoned.

replies.commentBody: Winston--Uh, I think the indictment comes BEFORE the trial.  Oh, yes there should be a trial.  There should be SEVERAL trials.

comments.commentBody: Jeff Sessions is not fit for the job of Attorney General.  He is a liar, a racist, and and criminal.  He lied, under oath, during confirmation hearings.  Fire him, then indict him.
PRESIDENT Barack Obama: One of the most brilliant, (cautious and insightful) individual to hold office.
There's evidence that indicates the Russians have been interfering in the elections of other countries (e.g. France) as well. Why aren't Republicans alarmed by this?

I'm sure our fearless, incorruptible FBI will get to the bottom of this one. Oh wait, the same FBI that basically cooked an American presidential election just three months ago?

Comey has been cozy with Republicans in Congress his whole career. He will do what he's told. If McConnell and Ryan have trouble controlling Trump, the FBI will provide the ammunition to blackmail him, and, if necessary, get him impeached.

But after last November, none of us should expect FBI will do the right thing for the country. The FBI should be considered an arm of the Republican Party at this point.

There is one way Congress can prevent Sessions from suppressing the Russian investigation:  a special investigator.  A Ken Starr for our so-called President's connections to Russia, campaign and otherwise.
Seems Obama did not want to be seen interfering in this manner with the election.  Would that the Republicans had a fraction of his decency.

"There continues to be no there, there", said Mr. Spicer. We've heard that before, and most times there is something there. With the passage of time we shall see.  A harbinger will be when headlines include the word "Russiagate".

It will essentially come down to who might be willing to go to jail for Donald Trump, and who will not.

If we consider the insular nature of Trump's campaign team, how it was always a family affair, who else was privy to this insider information? Ever in need to prove himself to his children, after his atrocious treatment of their mothers, Donald constantly heeds a call to impress them. If you think his narcissism unleashed on the world is bad, imagine being his kid.

If Donald sucked his children into this, he will certainly go for broke in his need to distract us. Will it be a scuffle with Iran? North Korea?

Or will McCain, the man who refused to use his status to abandon his brothers in a POW camp, allow a cowardly draft dodger to once again conjure a heel spur?

Expect Trump's attacks on the intelligence community to ramp up. Expect his attacks on the New York Times and Washington Post to escalate.

I have all along suspected that Trump has not divested of his assets because he knows he's going to need substantial resources to afford a defense of what very well may be the most criminal political scandal in American history. Collusion is treason, after all.

Imagine Sunday nights, watching Game of Thrones with his boys, musing about building a wall, chatting about the latest tip from Manafort's sources.

I'd place real money that somewhere there are servers, backed up, with all the evidence Trump knows is needed. Turn up the heat. Let's see who yells first.

The President's men are in trouble.

This whole Russian thing reminds me of a line in the movie "Wall Street":
".., you will sell your mother to make a deal,"

It is hard to see how 45 will ever be able to govern. To think about it, he never seemed to have the desire to govern.
This fight, a fight for our country, is worth having, so, let it roll.

replies.commentBody: I'm interested to see all the information that is going to start leaking out, regarding Obama's foreign policy failures in Libya, Syria and Iraq. I'm sure there is plenty of "confidential" intelligence that we'd all love to see. Also, maybe we can finally see the withheld files from Fast & Furious and the Lois Lerner scandals.
All this negative news about the Trump administration has been a bit hard to take, hey? Drip, drip, drip.... Get used to it.

Oh the irony.  Did you even read what you wrote - Obama aides should be "locked up" on your demand because they conducted an investigation of actual, documented contacts between Trump advisors and Russia?  How is conducting an investigation any crime?  & Trump voters wonder why thinking, educated people condescend to them.  Please.

comments.commentBody: Obama and his aides should ALL be locked up.  This is a disgusting display of abuse of power.  NO evidence that a single law was broken...yet because they failed for 8 years to work with Russia they want to poison the waters for the next president.  It is beyond disgusting.  While, clearly he was a failed president, I always thought he was a nice man.  I'm sickened to see how low and guttural he really is.  A SAD day in America.
When is Director Comey going to be implicated? Now THAT'S the connection that needs to be unearthed.
The hen house is full of foxes.
I feel like the Obama administration where like Hansel & Gretel leaving indestructible breadcrumbs leading to justice.

Would there be all this partisan outrage today if the same supposed contacts had been made with the Australians?  If elections are truly supposed to be purely objective academic exercises in choosing the most qualified candidate, why are campaigns even allowed - all they're about is propaganda and deception and selling myths.  The Russians couldn't have manipulated something that wasn't designed in the first place to be manipulated.  If not them, then the Koch brothers or any other number of well-connected could conceivably pull off the same.  I have a lot of fond childhood Cold War memories too and it would be fun to feel young again by trying to relive them, but where this seems to ultimately be taking us is stupid.  Aren't there enough problems to worry about without creating new ones?
Even the Nixon administration did not stink this badly, and they were a pack of low life scum. Do we really deserve this?

These and all accusations like them are clear, repeated attempts at disrupting the new pro America government that the left never thought would be elected. obama's operatives present nothing but accusations and repeated attempts to cripple Trump and his administration. There is never any proof presented and when that becomes evident, they move on to new accusations.  This is sedition plain and simple. If they continue the public will support arrests and swift trials for all involved. The alternative is a civil war in which the left will be completely decimated. And rightly so.

replies.commentBody: DrT, my concern is Sessions offering alternate facts to questions asked of him during his confirmation hearings. He denied having communications with the Russians when in fact he had. Twice. An AG of the US providing alternate facts to a reality does'nt bother you?

comments.commentBody: Seems like fake news to me. Is talking to a Russian now a crime ? Pathetic how the left can't cope with the election loss. They need psychological help

Many have said here that Obama was far too slow to respond and publish what he knew. Not hard to imagine how that would have been spun and twisted by Trump & GOP as Obama/Hilary/Dem desperation to sway the election and discredit Trump. And would have tipped them off to start covering there tracks. Power under restraint takes immense discipline and patience especially when your reputation, accomplishments and legacy are being slandered. Obama White House was shrewd and deliberate, quietly preserving intel so that we could get Flynn,Sessions, Trump etc. denials on record. It took down Flynn, and now maybe Sessions too, and we can only hope Trump. This steady drum beat also serves to keep Trump WH on defensive, distracted and irritated. As it is they cannot get any traction; signatures on executive orders are just smoke and mirrors for his faithful.

Listen - Trump supporters don't care now - they voted for him and to denounce him now would mean they take responsibility for the destruction and peril of the US he will cause. But this will change when they personally experience their healthcare being taken away, and understand that their job lost is not coming back due to automation and modernization, and start paying more for retail and food because of import taxes and loss of immigrant workers. Then this steady drip drip of Russian involvement with Trump and election will be the backdrop the GOP cannot get away from.
